result.execSummary:
The defendant Ntxhw Xiong was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal) [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ntxhw Xiong in court with attorney Acalia Halverson. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
10:20 a.m.  Court calls the case. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of:  Counts 2 & 3 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty Counts 2 & 3.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1 is dismissed and read-in. 

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Halverson makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
Serve 45 days jail on each count, concurrent.
2 days credit.
Huber granted if appropriate.
Sentence to commence within 60 days. 
Must report today for start date.  
Count 3 - Pay fine $100 plus costs as requested by the DA.  To be paid within 60 days or set up a payment plan.
Count 2 - Pay costs.
Not drive until and unless he obtains a license to permit him to drive. 

Count 1 is dismissed and read-in. 

Atty Knaapen makes arguments re: jail credit. 
Atty Halverson makes arguments re: jail credit. 
Atty Knaapen makes additional arguments to the Court.

Defendant Ntxhw Xiong in court with attorney Acalia Halverson. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

Arraignment:
State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Ntxhw Xiong in court with attorney Acalia Halverson. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

9:18 AM Court calls case.

Atty Halverson received a copy of the complaint and waives reading.

Preliminary Hearing will be set. 

Atty Halverson is willing to waive time limits.

State addresses bond, there is a current signature bond set. 

BY THE COURT:
Bond is ordered continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Do not operate a vehicle without a valid driver's license. Report to the public defender's office within 24 hours to determine eligibility.

Defendant Ntxhw Xiong in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

9:29 AM Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states appearances.

Defendant has received a copy of the complaint.

Court informs Defendant of charges and penalties.
Defendant understands.

Defendant wishes to consult with an attorney.

State requests an adjourned initial appearance.
Defendant is working part time.

State addresses bond.

  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 09:00 am.
